title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: King Dollar won’t just give up its crown. Rivals have to take it away—but they’re not ready, currency expert says
items.description: "Unless that changes, the dollar will remain on a much longer leash than any currency should rightfully have."

items.title: Musk vows to be ‘super focused’ on companies amid X outages
items.description: “Back to spending 24/7 at work and sleeping in conference/server/factory rooms,” Musk wrote in a post on X on Saturday.

items.title: There’s a ‘buyer’s strike’ on U.S. assets as foreign investors can’t stomach huge deficits anymore, analyst warns
items.description: "At the core of the problem is that foreign investors are simply no longer willing to finance US twin deficits at current level of prices."

items.title: Junkiest junk is offering a warning sign for debt
items.description: The lowest rung of junk bonds are flashing warnings that the economy could face slower growth and higher inflation, as well as the risk of a recession...

items.title: Trump tells West Point graduates ‘we do not need an officer corps of careerists and yes men’
items.description: “We need patriots with guts and vision and backbone.”

items.title: Why wealth rarely survives grandchildren — and how your family can beat the odds
Ship crossings to the U.S. are being canceled. Trump’s latest threat won’t help.
Rising bond yields give stock-market investors the yips. Watch these levels.
Apple has been the worst Big Tech stock lately. What investors are missing.
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang now wants to help his rivals succeed. He’s not crazy.
